greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest triangular number dividing n.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: a(12)=6 because the triangular numbers dividing 12 are 1,3 and 6.
maple: a:=proc(n) local P,j; P:={}: for j from 1 to n do if type(n/(j*(j+1)/2),integer)=true then P:=P union {j*(j+1)/2} else P:=P: fi od: P[nops(P)]; end: seq(a(n),n=1..105); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 01 2006
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Feb 23 2006
